captions.text:
Hey guys it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I’ve been getting so many requests from
you guys to do something else Adventure Time

themed, and I love Adventure Time, and if
you can tell, my favorite character is
LSP! Lumpy Space Princess!

I also like cheesecake, so I thought, let’s
make some LSP Cheesecakes.
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 1 cup of
regular sugar, 2 cups of sour cream,

2 sh-ticks of cream cheese, 3 eggs, 1 tablespoon
of vanilla extract. A few drops

of icing coloring, the color I’m using is
violet. And I’m using a few drops of

raspberry flavoring, this part is totally
optional, if you remove this step it will just

be regular cheesecake. But I want a little
bit of Raspberry cheesecake today!

And then to make the crust for our cheesecake
you will need 1 cup of graham cracker

crumbs. These were so easy to make, I just
got a few graham crackers and threw them

in the blender and ta-da! 1 cup of graham
cracker crumbs!

Then you’ll also need 1/2 a stick of butter
and a pinch of cinnamon.

Then, to make the shape of Lumpy Space Princess,
we are gonna be using this mini

flower silicone mold, this one’s by Wilton.
And if you’re interested in getting this

I’ll put a link down below so that it’s
easy to find.

I just love these silicone molds because they’re
so easy to work with, and, look!
It’s a flower shape but multi-purpose!

We’re gonna be making Lumpy Space Princess!
Oh-hu-hu!
Alright, let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is make
our cheesecake crust, it’s really easy!

You’re gonna take your cup of graham crackers,
put it in a mixing bowl, melt your

1/2 a stick of butter and pour it in. Then
you’re gonna add a pinch of cinnamon,

then you’re gonna whisk it all together.
Now that we’ve got our crust all mixed up,

we are gonna take a tablespoon, do a scoop,
and we’re gonna put it into each mold.

You can use your fingers to pack it down once
it’s in there. Now that our crust

is all packed into the mold, I’m gonna place
this in the fridge for about
10 minutes to chill. And while this is chilling,
we are gonna make our cheesecake filling!

To make our cheesecake filling, the first
thing that we’re gonna do is mix together

our cream cheeses until they are nice and
smooth. I’m using a stand mixer, but

if you don’t have 1 of these you can also
use a regular hand mixer. No big D!

And we’re just gonna stir together for about
a minute on a medium speed.

Now add your sugar and mix for about 1 minute.
You want to make sure to scrape

down the sides in between mixing, so that
everything evenly mixes.

Now we’re gonna add our 3 eggs, and I’m
gonna add my vanilla as well.
Now we’re gonna mix it for another minute.
Now we’re gonna scoop in our sour cream.

Now we’re gonna mix again until it’s nice
and smooth and then we’re gonna add

some coloring. This part is totally optional,
I’m gonna be adding a little bit of

raspberry flavoring, and not too much, just
a little bit!

And then we’re gonna be adding a few drops
of our coloring, of violet, and just keep

adding color as you’re mixing until it becomes
the desired Lumpy Space Princess
purple that you love!

Now that our cheesecake filling is all done,
I just took our mold out of the

fridge, and now you’re gonna take a
little spoon, and you’re just gonna spoon

in the cheesecake filling to each mold! And
remember when you’re making cheesecake,

it does not rise in the oven like a regular
cake, so you can fill them all the way to the top.

This recipe that we’re using today is enough
to fill 2 molds, so you’ll be able to
make 12 little Lumpy Space Princesses!

Now that we’ve got our molds completely
filled, we’re ready to bake!

We’ve got to get our pan ready. Right over
here I have a roasting pan, I’ll put a

link down below so that you can order the
same 1 if you would like, and you’re gonna

take out this little rack in the middle. Move
it over here, and we’re gonna move

very carefully, our molds on top of the rack.
To just sit right here,

right in the middle. And then in our pan,
we’re gonna pour in 10 cups of water.

Now we’re gonna head over to the oven, you’re
gonna preheat your oven to 325 degrees,

and we’re gonna place in the pan with the
water. And as the oven pre-heats, we’re

gonna allow the water to heat up as well.
Once it’s heated, you’re gonna take your

rack with the molds on top and gently place
it down into the water in the pan.

Then you’re gonna bake for 27 minutes! Once
your little cheesecakes are done baking, you’re

gonna carefully remove the rack from the oven.
Use your hot mitts, it’s very hot!

And then we’re just gonna let them sit at
room temperature for 1 hour,

and then we’re gonna pop these in the fridge
to chill for 3 full hours.

After your little cheesecakes have chilled
in the fridge, now we’re gonna pop them

out and decorate! I just wanted to show you
how to pop ‘em out.

It’s really, really easy! Because these
are silicone molds, you can bend them.

So you just pull them apart, I like to pull
off the sides, just a little bit,

give it a little stretch. And then push from
underneath, oh, look! There we go!
And it’s popped out! Little cheesecake!
Now it’s time to decorate, my favorite part!

To decorate, you’ll be needing some jumbo
sprinkle stars, I’ll put a link down

below where you can find these. And we're gonna
be using some black decorative icing.

I really like these because they have, at
the end, you can put little adjustable

tips for more control. And I’m using a umber
2 tip to make
her little facial expressions!

I love this idea because it’s super easy
to decorate!

You’re just gonna take a little star, put
it right on the top

where her head is, ooooh! Then you’re gonna
take your decorative icing and

draw her little eyeballs. You can get really
creative with it, Lumpy Space Princess

has so many facial expressions. Mostly sassy
faces, so if you want to do all sass
face, that is totally OK!

Ta-da! Here are the Lumpy Space Princess Mini
Cheesecakes that we made today!

I hope you guys enjoyed them, they were so
much fun to make. I love that you can

make her facial expressions different on every
single 1! So if you have a friend

who likes her when she’s sassy, or when
she’s cute or scared, you can do

whatever you’d like. I’ll be posting lots
of pictures of these on Facebook, Tumblr,
Instagram and Twitter!

And if you guys make these please send me
photos, I get a big kick out of seeing

your baking creations! It just kind of makes
my day!

Also, to learn more about silicone molds and
how to bake with them, I’ll put a link

down below to a video I made with Wilton,
so you can go check it out!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks you guys, bye-bye!

title: LUMPY SPACE PRINCESS CHEESECAKE - NERDY NUMMIES
